numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A legacy applicant is an applicant whose parent attended the university.
2. Some universities give higher advantages to legacy applicants.
3. Some universities give especially high advantages to a legacy applicant if the parent of the legacy applicant has a high income rank.
4. An applicant can have no legacy status.
5. A poorer applicant with no legacy status can have a higher chance of admission than a richer applicant with no legacy status.
6. Two students can get the same test scores.
7. Legacy status can matter more even if two students get the same test scores.
8. I wonder what advantages a student gets if the student has no legacy status.
